frontEnd.name: Chris Coyier
frontEnd.description: Founder of CSS-Tricks and co-founder of CodePen. Known for practical CSS tutorials and front-end insights.
tasks: Recreate a responsive layout using only CSS Grid and Flexbox from a real news site.
Build a custom CodePen-like HTML/CSS/JS editor in the browser.
Implement a dark/light mode toggle with localStorage state persistence.
Design and code a responsive multi-level navigation menu using only CSS.
Create a fluid typography system using clamp() and rem units.
Build a landing page with embedded animations using CSS keyframes and transitions.

frontEnd.name: Una Kravets
frontEnd.description: Developer advocate at Google Chrome. Expert in CSS, UI design systems, and performance.
tasks: Create a design system using CSS variables and a11y standards.
Build a reusable, accessible component library (dropdowns, modals, tabs).
Convert a Figma design to pixel-perfect HTML/CSS with performance optimizations.
Use CSS Houdini to create a custom paint worklet for a pattern background.
Implement lazy loading and asset optimization for a large UI project.
Set up and document a performance budget using Lighthouse and DevTools.

frontEnd.name: Lea Verou
frontEnd.description: Co-creator of reveal.js and Slides.com. Known for stunning interactive UI experiments.
tasks: Build a web-based interactive presentation system using reveal.js.
Create a color contrast checker using JavaScript and WCAG rules.
Develop an advanced form with real-time validation using Regex and HTML5 APIs.
Animate SVG paths based on user input using CSS and JS.
Build an interactive color picker from scratch using native JS and CSS.
Use CSS custom properties to create a theme switcher for a UI kit.

backEnd.name: DHH (David Heinemeier Hansson)
backEnd.description: Creator of Ruby on Rails. Co-founder of Basecamp. Known for bold views on software and startups.
tasks: Build a blog platform using Ruby on Rails with authentication and admin panel.
Create a background job system with Sidekiq to handle emails and reports.
Implement a RESTful API with versioning and token-based authentication.
Add caching (page and fragment) to a Rails app to boost performance.
Use Action Mailer to build a fully templated notification system.
Integrate Stripe for subscription billing in a SaaS Rails project.

backEnd.name: Matz (Yukihiro Matsumoto)
backEnd.description: Creator of the Ruby programming language. Respected for his philosophy on developer happiness.
tasks: Create a gem that parses and transforms markdown to HTML.
Write a CLI tool in pure Ruby to manage to-do tasks with file storage.
Build a minimalistic MVC web framework in Ruby from scratch.
Use metaprogramming to dynamically generate model methods.
Create a plugin system using Ruby modules and mixins.
Profile and optimize a Ruby app using `benchmark` and `memory_profiler`.

backEnd.name: Mitchell Hashimoto
backEnd.description: Founder of HashiCorp. Creator of Vagrant and Terraform. Expert in backend infrastructure tools.
tasks: Write a Vagrantfile to provision a reproducible development environment.
Use Terraform to provision a scalable AWS EC2 + S3 stack.
Implement a Consul-based service discovery system in a microservices project.
Create a plugin for Vagrant to support a custom VM provider.
Set up a secure Vault-based secrets management service in a backend project.
Automate deployment workflows using Terraform Cloud or GitHub Actions.

fullStack.name: Evan You
fullStack.description: Creator of Vue.js. Former Google engineer. Full-stack capabilities with focus on simplicity and performance.
tasks: Build a full-stack Todo app with Vue 3, Pinia, and Firebase.
Use Vue Router and Composition API to handle dynamic page routing.
Connect a Node.js backend to a Vue frontend using REST APIs.
Implement SSR (Server-Side Rendering) in a Nuxt.js app.
Create a plugin system for a Vue-based admin panel.
Deploy a Vue + Express full-stack project using Vercel or Netlify + Render.

fullStack.name: Guillermo Rauch
fullStack.description: CEO of Vercel and creator of Next.js. Advocate for full-stack serverless web development.
tasks: Build a full-stack blog with Next.js using Static Site Generation (SSG).
Implement authentication using NextAuth.js and JWT.
Use serverless functions for dynamic routes (e.g., comments, orders).
Deploy an e-commerce app with Next.js + Stripe integration.
Integrate a CMS like Sanity or Contentful with ISR in Next.js.
Add middleware to a Next.js project for route-based access control.

fullStack.name: Ryan Dahl
fullStack.description: Creator of Node.js and Deno. A pioneer in full-stack JavaScript runtimes and tooling.
tasks: Build a REST API with Deno and Oak framework.
Create a simple static site generator using Deno.
Implement role-based access control in a Node.js + Express app.
Migrate a Node.js project to Deno with improved permissions and security.
Use WebSockets in Node.js to create a real-time chat app.
Build a CLI app using Deno's built-in permission system and bundler.

crossPlatform.name: Russell Keith-Magee
crossPlatform.description: Creator of BeeWare, enabling Python developers to build native apps across platforms.
tasks: Build a native Android and iOS app using BeeWare's Toga library.
Create a cross-platform desktop and mobile app with a shared Python codebase.
Implement platform-specific UI adaptations using BeeWare's APIs.
Develop a plugin system for extending app functionalities.
Integrate SQLite for local data storage within the app.
Deploy the app to both Google Play Store and Apple App Store.

crossPlatform.name: Kivy Team
crossPlatform.description: Developers of Kivy, an open-source Python framework for developing multitouch applications.
tasks: Design a responsive UI for various screen sizes using Kivy's layout system.
Implement gesture-based navigation within the app.
Create custom widgets to enhance user interaction.
Integrate OpenGL graphics for dynamic visualizations.
Develop a real-time chat application using Kivy and WebSocket.
Package the app for Android using Buildozer.

crossPlatform.name: Mike Matas
crossPlatform.description: Co-founder of Push Pop Press and former designer at Apple and Facebook. Known for his work on interactive digital books and user interfaces.
tasks: Design a responsive UI for various screen sizes using Kivy's layout system.
Implement gesture-based navigation within the app.
Create custom widgets to enhance user interaction.
Integrate OpenGL graphics for dynamic visualizations.
Develop a real-time chat application using Kivy and WebSocket.
Package the app for Android using Buildozer.

native.name: Dong Nguyen
native.description: Vietnamese developer behind the viral game 'Flappy Bird,' which became a cultural phenomenon in mobile gaming.
tasks: Build a native iOS app using Swift and SwiftUI.
Implement Core Data for local data persistence.
Utilize Combine framework for reactive programming.
Integrate Apple's ARKit for augmented reality features.
Implement in-app purchases and subscriptions.
Deploy the app using TestFlight for beta testing.

native.name: Jake Wharton
native.description: Android developer and contributor to numerous open-source Android libraries.
tasks: Develop a native Android app using Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
Implement Room database for local storage.
Use Retrofit for networking and API calls.
Integrate Firebase for authentication and analytics.
Implement background tasks using WorkManager.
Optimize app performance and memory usage.

native.description: Co-founder of Tinder, revolutionizing the dating app industry with a swipe-based interface.

tasks: Conduct user research to identify pain points and needs.
Develop user personas and journey maps.
Create wireframes and interactive prototypes.
Perform usability testing and iterate designs accordingly.
Collaborate with developers to ensure design feasibility.
Advocate for accessible and inclusive design practices.

Mentor junior designers and foster a collaborative environment.
Align design goals with business objectives.
Present design strategies to stakeholders.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices.
